subject: Music
title: Romantic Music Unleashed
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Romantic Music Unleashed.

hook.text: Romantic composers threw away classical restraint and let raw emotion flood the concert hall.

buildup.text: The Romantic era, roughly 1820 to 1900, prized individual expression above formal rules.

discovery.text: Orchestras grew larger, dynamics grew wider, and pieces grew longer and more dramatic.

twist.text: Classical critics called it self-indulgent. Audiences called it the greatest music ever written.

climax.text: The era produced Chopin, Liszt, Wagner, Brahms, and Tchaikovsky â€” a golden age.

punchline.text: Rules create elegance. Breaking them creates greatness.

quiz.question: What defined the Romantic era in music?
options: Individual expression and emotion over formal rules
